section: 8.1 TERM. The term of this Agreement shall continue for one (1) year following the Launch Date, unless earlier terminated as provided herein. This Agreement may be renewed for any number of successive one (1) year terms by mutual written agreement of the parties prior to the conclusion of the term of this Agreement. A party wishing to renew this Agreement shall give the other party notice thereof no less than thirty (30) days before the expiration of the term then in effect. In the event that either party does not give such notice, the term of this Agreement shall be automatically renewed for another one (1) year.
explanation: There is an inconsistency regarding the renewal of the agreement. The text states that the agreement may be renewed by mutual written agreement, requiring affirmative consent from both parties. However, it further stipulates that if neither party provides notice of non-renewal at least 30 days before the expiration, the agreement is automatically renewed for another year. This creates a contradiction because the 'mutual written agreement' clause implies active consent, while the 'automatic renewal' clause implies passive consent, creating confusion on how to properly renew the agreement.

section: 9. INDEMNITY. Each party (the "Guarantor") shall protect the other party (the "Protected Party") from any and all liabilities, damages, charges, and expenditures, specifically including legal counsel payments, that the Protected Party accrues due to external grievances resulting from the Guarantor's actions, failures, or deceptive statements, provided the Protected Party is considered a key agent of the Guarantor. Furthermore, 2TheMart will protect i-Escrow from all liabilities, damages, charges, and expenditures, inclusive of justifiable legal costs, that i-Escrow bears due to external grievances derived from 2TheMart Material. Additionally, i-Escrow will protect 2TheMart from all liabilities, damages, charges, and expenditures, including justified attorney costs, that 2TheMart bears due to external grievances arising from i-Escrow Media and/or the Deliverables provided to Patrons.
explanation: The initial part of the indemnity clause requires the 'Protected Party' to be considered a 'key agent of the Guarantor,' which is vague and undefined. It is not clear what constitutes a 'key agent' or what criteria are used to determine this status. This undefined term introduces ambiguity and makes it difficult to determine when the indemnification obligation is triggered, potentially leading to disputes over the scope and applicability of the indemnity.

section: 12.4 FORCE MAJEURE. Except as otherwise provided, if performance hereunder (other than payment) is prevented, restricted or interfered with by any act or condition whatsoever beyond the reasonable control of a party (a "force majeure event"), the party so affected, upon giving prompt notice to the other party, shall be excused from such performance to the extent of such prevention, restriction or interference. However, if a force majeure event interferes with the operation of this Agreement for sixty (60) days or more, either party can terminate this Agreement, without penalty. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the occurrence of any force majeure event shall not limit either party's obligations under Section 9 with respect to any third party claim as to which the other party seeks indemnification.
explanation: The clause explicitly states that a force majeure event does not limit the obligations under Section 9 (Indemnity). This creates a legal contradiction if a force majeure event directly causes a situation that would otherwise trigger the indemnity clause. For example, if a natural disaster leads to a breach of contract by i-Escrow, which in turn leads to a claim against 2TheMart, the indemnification obligation would still apply, despite the force majeure event. This means i-Escrow is still liable for the indemnity even if they could not control the action, failure or deceptive statement.
